intro: Polypodium murorum, commonly known as wall fern, is a species of fern belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is characterized by its creeping rhizome and lance-shaped fronds that are typically 10–30 cm long. The plant thrives in moist, shaded environments, often growing on rocky surfaces or in crevices. Its spore-producing structures, called sori, are located on the underside of the fronds. Polypodium murorum is widely distributed across temperate regions and is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value.
